meanings.definition: To conceal in the palm of the hand.
meanings.sent1: She was palming the small key to surprise her friend.
meanings.sent2: He palmed the coin before showing it to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The magician was caught palming an extra card up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The student was palming the cheat sheet during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The thief was skilled at palming valuables without being noticed.

meanings.definition: To strike or catch with the palm of the hand.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally palmed the ball during the game.
meanings.sent2: She palmed the mosquito before it could bite her.
meanings.sent3: The chef was palming the dough to make perfect bread rolls.
meanings.sent4: The athlete palmed the opponent's hand away in a swift move.
meanings.sent5: The cat palmed the toy mouse with precision and grace.
